sentence.text: Human genetic evidence demonstrates that positive regulation of cell proliferation mutations cause osteogenesis imperfecta (OI) and early-onset osteoporosis, implicating WNT1 as a major regulator of bone metabolism.

Targeted deletion of positive regulation of cell proliferation in mesenchymal progenitors led to spontaneous fractures due to impaired osteoblast function and increased bone resorption, mimicking the severe OI phenotype in humans with homozygous positive regulation of cell proliferation mutations.
